column4: im having trouble mounting my external Usb hdd  Fstab shows that it is this device. but no luck:  Disk /dev/sdf: 320.0 GB, 320072932864 bytes
what error do you get when trying to mount?
mount: you must specify the filesystem type
what filesystem does it use?
ext3
okay
paste your /etc/fstab on pastebin and I'll take a look at it
http://pastebin.com/d36e9ac54
which partition are you trying to mount?
sudo mount /dev/sdf /mnt/bighdd/
try adding this line to fstab: /dev/sdf /mnt/bighdd ext3 defaults 0 0
make a backup first
and try running sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sdf/ /mnt/bighdd
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sdf,
weird
there was more but i didnt wanna flood
does /mnt/bighdd exist?
yep
okay. you sure it's ext3?
yeah
it used to mount just fine until i tripped over the usb cord this morning
aah I see
have you ran fsck on it?
i will later on i gotta go, thanks for the help :D
